patterns: tell me about uttarakhand NFSA new ration list 2023?
what is uttarakhand NFSA new ration list 2023?

explain National Food Security Act
tell me about National Food Security Act
what is National Food Security Act?

what do you mean by uttarakhand NFSA new ration list 2023?
what is bpl ration card list in uttarakhand?
which scheme is released by food and civil supplies dept. of uttarakhand?
responses: Uttarakhand govt. has made this UK ration card new list 2023 public in order to make the process of finding name of beneficiaries in BPL Ration Card List easier. People can also find their name online in the Uttarakhand NFSA Ration Card List 2023. People can now even find their name in the ration cards for below poverty line (BPL) / Antyodaya beneficiaries. NFSA / BPL Ration Card in Uttarakhand is an essential document for the APL / BPL people to take benefits of most govt. schemes. It is important to note that ration card holders only can purchase Ration at subsidized rates from Ration Shops located nearby. Moreover, ration card holders can only take benefits of National Food Security Scheme-NFSA (AAY + PHH), State Food Scheme (SFY) or Mid day Meal Scheme

food and Civil Supplies Department of Uttarakhand has released the district wise UK NFSA Ration Card List 2023 online at fcs.uk.gov.in (उत्तराखंड राशन कार्ड सूची ऑनलाइन). All the citizens who had previously made fresh registrations for ration card can now check their name online in Uttarakhand Ration Card List 2023 or by downloading the list of eligible National Food Security Act (NFSA) beneficiaries. Uttarakhand BPL / NFSA Ration Card List 2023 is now available online at the official website of Department of Food, Civil Supplies & Consumer Affairs department. to know more about nfsa visit fcs.uk.gov.in

The Food and Civil Supplies Department of Uttarakhand is functional since the reorganization of the state, and it has adopted the operational structure identical to the erstwhile state of Uttar Pradesh. The State is divided into two regions Garhwal and Kumaon. One Regional Food Controller for procurement and distribution and One Assistant Commissioner for distribution at each of these regions overlook the operations. The Commissioner's Office at Dehradun supervises the entire operations. 13 District Supply Offices (DSO's) situated in each district form the implementation arm of the schemes.

People can also find their name online in the Uttarakhand NFSA Ration Card List 2023. People can now even find their name in the ration cards for below poverty line (BPL) / Antyodaya beneficiaries.

NFSA / BPL Ration Card in Uttarakhand is an essential document for the APL / BPL people to take benefits of most govt. schemes. It is important to note that ration card holders only can purchase Ration at subsidized rates from Ration Shops located nearby. Moreover, ration card holders can only take benefits of National Food Security Scheme-NFSA (AAY + PHH), State Food Scheme (SFY) or Mid day Meal Scheme.

responses:
All the applicants must meet the basic eligibility criteria to get a new ration card in Uttarakhand:-

a) Applicants who are permanent resident of Uttarakhand can apply.
b) Households not already having ration card in the state are eligible.
c) Newly married couples can apply for new ration card.
d) Citizens having temporary ration cards or whose date has been expired are eligible.

It is important to note that the issue of new ration card in Uttarakhand would be based on the household income as well as economic conditions of the family.

patterns: What are the documents needed for a new ration card in Uttarakhand?
Lists of documents to apply for a new ration card in Uttarakhand?
Documents needed to apply for NFSE Uttarakhand?
responses: Below is the complete list of documents required to apply online for a new ration card in Uttarakhand:
1. Residential Address proof such as Voter ID, Driving License, Aadhaar Card (Scanned Copy)
2. Age Certificate (Scanned Copy)
3. Identity Proof like Voter ID, Driving Licence, Aadhaar Card (Scanned Copy)
4. Income proof of the family (Scanned Copy)
5. Recent Passport Size Photograph of the applicant
6. Valid Mobile Number / E-mail ID
7. Self Declaration and Certificate issued by Ward Councillor/ Pradhan
8. Tenancy Agreement (if applicable)
In case of non-possession of above mentioned documents, applications for new ration cards are liable to get rejected.

responses: The citizens of Uttarakhand whose name is not present in the Ration Card List can apply online for new ration card at the official website fcs.uk.gov.in.

Here is the direct link to check complete process to fill online application / registration form for name inclusion in Uttarakhand RC Holder list:-
Ration Card Card Online Form Uttarakhand

There is no application form filling fee and there is no requirement to pay any fees while applying online for new ration card in Uttarakhand. However, applicants can collect their ration cards from the concerned authorities on making a payment of Rs. 5 per copy.
All the applicants can submit the complete Uttarakhand Ration Card online application form and new ration cards would be issued within 15 days of submission of application.

patterns: how to check the name in uttarakhand new ration card list 2023 for NFSA beneficiaries
how to check for updates in schemes of NFSA uttarakhand 2023?
overview of uttarakhand ration card?
types of ration in card in uttarakhand
responses:
All the candidates who had previously applied for the new ration card now check their name in Uttarakhand New ration card list 2023 for NFSA beneficiaries as per the procedure below:-

 STEP 1: Firstly, visit official website of dept. of Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs at https://fcs.uk.gov.in/
 STEP 2: At the homepage, click at the “Ration Card Details” link present on the left side of the page. Note that this page is not secure but you can still proceed to it as it is safe.
 STEP 3: Upon verification of captcha, the UK RCMS Show Report page will appear online.

 STEP 4: On subsequent verification of captcha, the UK RCMS Show Report page will appear online
 STEP 5: Here candidates can select the name of district, DFSO, scheme, date and report name and click at the View Report button to open the page for UK NFSA DFSO wise RC count page
 STEP 6: Here click the link under 'DFSO' section to open the Uttarakhand NFSA TFSO wise RC count 2023 page as shown below.
 STEP 7: Click at the link under 'TFSO' section to open the FPS wise RC count page at the official fcs.uk.gov.in (previously fcs.uk.nic.in) website.

Here is an overview of Uttarakhand Ration Card which is mentioned in the table below:-

 Service Type	Ration Card
 State Name	Uttarakhand
 Article Category	Uttarakhand Ration Card List
 Concerned Department	Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs Department, Govt. of Uttarakhand
 Applicable Year	2023
 Types of Ration Cards	APL Ration Cards (Yellow), BPL Ration Cards (White), Annapurna Yojana Ration Cards (Green), Antyodaya Anna Yojana Ration Cards (Pink), State Food Security Scheme
 Mode of Checking List	Online
 Official Portal	http://fcs.uk.gov.in/ (earlier fcs.uk.nic.in)

There are 4 different types of ration cards which are issued to citizens on the basis of their financial conditions as well as income level. The different types of ration cards issued to citizens of Uttarakhand are as follows:-

 APL Ration Card (Yellow Card) – Above Poverty Line families whose annual income is above Rs.15,000.
 State Food Security Scheme / BPL Ration Card (White Card) – BPL RC are issued to Below Poverty Line families.
 Antyodaya Anna Yojna Ration Card (Pink Cards) – AYY ration cards are issued to those households having annual income below Rs. 15,000.
 Annapurna Yojana (Green Card) – Senior citizens of above 60 years of age or person above 65 years and not receiving any pension facilities.

patterns: is there any scheme for girls to travel free in UTC buses?

responses: Chief Minister has announced Uttarakhand Free Bus Travel Scheme 2023 for girl students across the state. In this UK Free Bus Ride scheme for girls, the state govt. will allow all the girl students to travel free-of-cost in all State Transport Corporation Limited (STCL) buses. For this purpose, free girl pass would be issued for zero cost travel in all Uttarakhand roadways buses. In this article, we will tell you how a girl student can apply online for Free Roadways Bus Pass in Uttarakhand.

On 17 December 2021 (Friday) Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami announced that girl students in the state will be able to travel for free in buses. CM Dhami announced this move to make education for girls an easy experience and free travel across the state will aid in that.As part of the free travel sop, girl students would be able to travel not just in ordinary buses but also deluxe and luxury coaches of the Uttarakhand Transport Corporation Limited. The state government would soon be undertaking an exercise to make ID cards of all bonafide girl students so that they can avail of this scheme,” said a senior official in the transport department.

Under this scheme, girls will be allowed to travel for free in the buses of Transport Corporation Limited (STCL) 1. The scheme was announced by UK (Uttarakhand) CM Pushkar Singh Dhami on Friday, 17th December 2021 1. The free girl passes will be issued for zero cost travel in all buses of Uttarakhand Roadways 1. This scheme is aimed at promoting education among girls and making it easier for them to travel to their schools and colleges 2.

CM Pushkar Singh Dhami led state govt. has launched Uttarakhand Free Electricity Scheme 2023. In this scheme, the state govt. will provide 100 units of free electricity every month to domestic consumers. Power Consumption beyond that and upto 200 units would be charged at 50% tariff. patterns: who is eligible for Uttarakhand Free Electricity Scheme 2023?
what are the eligibility criteria for UFES 2023?
am I eligible for UFES 2023?
who can apply for Uttarakhand Free Electricity Scheme 2023?
responses:
Eligibility criteria for uttarakhand free electricity scheme 2023 are the beneficiary must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
The beneficiary must have a valid electricity connection in their name.
The beneficiary must not have a pending electricity bill of more than Rs. 10,000. The beneficiary should have a meter reading of up to 100 units per month.
The beneficiary should not be availing any other subsidy or benefit from the government in regards to electricity.
If you meet the above criteria, you are eligible for UFES 2023.

patterns: when will Uttarakhand Free Electricity Scheme 2023 be implemented?

what is the implementation schedule for Uttarakhand Free Electricity Scheme 2023?
responses:
Implementation of Uttarakhand Free Electricity Scheme 2023.
The scheme is expected to be implemented from April 2023.
The government will incur an implementation cost of Rs. 400 to Rs. 500 crore.
Cabinet Minister Harak Singh Rawat has announced the launch of the scheme.
Once implemented, eligible beneficiaries can start availing the benefits of UFES 2023.

responses: https://www.upcl.org/saubhagya/#
1912  @upcl.org

Uttarakhand Free Electricity Scheme 2023 will put a burden of around Rs. 400 to Rs. 500 crore per annum on the state exchequer. This initiative it will provide relief to a large section of the state’s population. In the Himalayan state, Uttarakhand Power Corporation Limited (UPCL), a government of Uttarakhand undertaking, is the sole distributor of electricity in the state. UPCL is currently supplying electricity to over 2.5 million consumers across the state.
Department of Energy and Renewable Energy was preparing the proposal to present to the Cabinet in its next meeting. The state govt. rejected the speculation that the Uttarakhand Free Electricity scheme is being introduced to check the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) from taking root in the state, as free electricity and water are poll promises of the latter. AAP govt. is attacking ruling BJP govt. on issues like corruption, unemployment and health through various political events and on social media.
In December 2020, senior AAP leader and Delhi deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia visited the state and announced that the AAP party will fight on all 70 assembly seats.

patterns: tell me about tilu rauteli special pension scheme
what is tilu rauteli special pension scheme?
explain tilu rauteli special pension scheme
i want to know more about tilu rauteli special pension scheme
responses: Teelu Rauteli Special Pension Scheme is started by Social Welfare Department (Government of Uttarakhand) for physically handicapped Women Farmers. Under this scheme, the government provides financial assistance of Rs. 800 per month for disabled women who are engaged in agriculture work or agriculture-related business in the state. This scheme is effective from the 1st April 2014 and implemented by the social welfare department in Uttarakhand.

The name of the scheme Teelu Rauteli was a female warrior and folk hero who lived in Gurad Village (Pargana Chaundkot) Garhwal, Uttrakhand. During the 17th century, she fought in seven wars between the ages of fifteen and twenty.

the government provides financial assistance of Rs. 800 per month for disabled women who are engaged in agriculture work or agriculture-related business in the state. Uttarakhand government has taken very good intuitive by providing special pension to the women farmers who are physically handicapped while collecting fodder or mate with an accident during agriculture-related work Uttarakhand government has taken very good intuitive by providing special pension to the women farmers who are physically handicapped while collecting fodder or mate with an accident during agriculture-related work

In case of disability in agricultural work of women and men engaged in agricultural business, the scheme has been started by relaxing the provisions of the Divyang Bharan Nutrition Grant Scheme already in the state under the provisions of Divyang Bharan Poshan Grant Scheme under the following conditions and restrictions:
This assistance is being provided in special circumstances due to the disability of women and men engaged in agribusiness in rural areas. Therefore despite the scheme already implemented, the name of this scheme has been given as Tilu Rauteli Special Pension Scheme

Tilu Rauteli Special Pension Scheme does not provide for monthly income limit and the scheme is applicable from 01 April 2014.
The benefit of Tilu Rauteli Special Pension Scheme will be allowed to such rural women and men, whose disability percentage is between 20 and 40. The age of the person / applicant should be more than 18 years and up to 60 years and no other scheme is being provided under the social security program. If such persons attain the age of 60 years and are eligible for old age pension at that time,then they will be given old age pension and this facility will be abolished.

Rs. 25 crore (Rs. 25.00 crore) for providing free text books to SC students. A provision of Rs 10 crore (Rs 10.00 crore) has been made to provide free text books to SC students and about Rs 1 crore 24 lakh (Rs 1.24 crore).

patterns: what is Uttarakhand Atal Awas Yojana (SC) Application Form 2023?
explain about Uttarakhand Atal Awas Yojana (SC) Application Form 2023
tell me baout Uttarakhand Atal Awas Yojana (SC) Application Form 2023
more about Uttarakhand Atal Awas Yojana (SC) Application Form 2023
what is UAAY (SC)?
responses:
Social Welfare department of Uttarakhand state is going to implement revised Atal Awas Yojana (SC) scheme. The new UK Atal Awaas Yojna will follow the similar lines of PM Awas Yojana Gramin of central government. The previous version of atal awas yojana  was discontinued because the financial assistance of Rs. 38,000 on construction of house to SC people of Uttarakhand was too low as compared to PMAY G housing scheme.
Now with the revised amount of Rs. 1.30 lakh, Atal Awas Yojana (SC) will be implemented to meet the housing expenses of SC category people. Social Welfare Minister Chandan Ram Das said that in this scheme, the financial assistance of Rs
38,000 per beneficiary for the construction of the building was very less, while there is a provision
to give an amount of Rs 1.30 lakh in the Prime Minister's Housing Scheme.
He said that now this subject of preparing a proposal to operate the Atal Awas Yojana on the same
lines will be placed in the next cabinet meeting.
The Cabinet Minister informed that the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana- Rural is currently benefiting
only those people who have been registered five years ago. In view of all this, it has been decided 
to re-operate the Atal Awas Yojana to provide relief to the poor.
It is known that there are five corporations and as many boards under the State Social Welfare
Department. Out of the loan given by the corporations, about Rs 20 crore is to be recovered. In
view of this, a 'one-time resolution scheme' is now being brought, so that the corporations can get
at least the principal back along with relief to the concerned persons.

patterns: explain Uttarakhand Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana 2023
tell me about Uttarakhand Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana 2023
what is Uttarakhand Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana 2023
brief about Uttarakhand Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana 2023
what is UMMY 2023?
explain UMMY
tell me about UMMY
responses: Uttarakhand government led by CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has started Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana 2023. In this CM Mahalakshmi Scheme, the state govt. will provide kits to mother and newborn children. Maha Lakshmi Kits will be given to pregnant women, lactating mothers and newborn girl child on the birth of first 2 girls or twin girls. Maha Laxmi Yojana is the revised name of the earlier Soubhagyawati Yojna launched by former CM Trivendra Singh Rawat.Uttarakhand government’s ambitious scheme namely Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana for new mothers and the newborn girl child, was launched by chief minister Pushkar Singh Dhami on 17 July 2021 (Saturday). CM Maha Lakshmi Scheme has seen quite a few twists and turns since it was announced by former CM Trivendra Rawat a couple of months ago. He had named the scheme “Soubhagyawati Yojana” and was all set to inaugurate it when he had to step down. His successor, Tirath Singh Rawat changed the name of the scheme to Mahalakshmi Yojana and was gearing up to launch it. But on the very day he was to inaugurate Maha Laxmi Yojana, he was summoned to Delhi and subsequently had to let go of the CM’s chair.

patterns: what is the eligibilty criteria of Uttarakhand Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana 2023
explain the eligibilty criteria of Uttarakhand Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana 2023
what is the eligibilty criteri of UMMY ?
responses:
Below is the complete eligibility criteria for Maha Lakshmi Scheme in Uttarakhand:-
Applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand stat
She must be pregnant women.
Only those pregnant ladies above 18 years of age would be eligible.
The family and dependents of all government employees paying Income Tax would not be covered under the project.
Only those candidates fulfilling the above mentioned eligibility criteria would be eligible.

responses:
Here is the complete list of documents required for Maha Laxmi Yojana in Uttarakhand:-
Identity Card such as Aadhaar Card.

Recent Passport Size Photographs
Bank Account Details

patterns: Mukhyamantri Maha Laxmi Kit to Mother / Newborn Girl Child
what items will be provided to the beneficiaries of the maha lakshmi yojana in uttarakhand?
Items in Pregnant Women Kit under Mahalakshmi Yojana
responses:
Under the Mahalakshmi Scheme, the new mothers and newborns would be provided with clothes and other accessories by the women and child welfare department. A total of 16,929 women have been initially identified to be benefitted across the state as part of Maha Laxmi Scheme. The Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Kit is being provided to the mother and the newborn girl child on the birth of the first two girls or twin girls.For mothers, the kit has dry fruits, two pair of socks, one scarf, two towels, one blanket or sheet, two cotton bedsheets, two packets of sanitary napkins, nail cutter, four bathing soaps, four detergent soaps and 500ml mustard oil.
After inaugurating the Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana along with women and child development minister Rekha Arya, Dhami said, “If we look around us, we will find that daughters take more care of their parents than sons. Today there is no area in life where daughters have not achieved success.” CM even added that the CM Maha Laxmi scheme is inspired by the “Beti Bachao, Beti Padhao” campaign of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Women and Child Welfare Department has designed this Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana and would be responsible for its successful implementation. For welfare of pregnant women, kits would be provided and the items in the pregnant ladies kits would be:-  
Women and Child Welfare Department has designed this Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Yojana and would be responsible for its successful implementation. For welfare of pregnant women, kits would be provided and the items in the pregnant ladies kits would be:-
250 Almond kernel/dry apricot/walnut two cotton gowns/sarees/suits
A shawl hot flower size 500 g chuara
One Scorf cotton/hot standard size Two pairs of socks standard size
One towel, two packets of large-sized sanitary napkins (eight per packet)
Two pairs of bed sheets (including pillow covers) a nail cutter
200 ml handwash liquid 1 coconut/sesame/mustard/chulu oil
Two laundry soap two bath soap
 Upon getting these Mukhyamantri Mahalaxmi Kits, it would be the responsibility of the mothers to utilize these items for themselves and their kids. This would ensure that both the pregnant women and newborn children stay healthy and hygienic. Health is the most important aspect if a state wants to grow fast as kids are the future of the state.

patterns: what is mahatma ganndhi nrega?
what is Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
explain about MGNREGA
tell me about Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
i want to know more about MGNREGA
significance of MGNREGA yojana
MGNERGA
responses:
Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) is a job guarantee scheme for rural Indians. It was enacted by legislation on 25 August 2005.   The scheme provides a legal guarantee for at least 100 days of paid employment in every financial year to adult members of any household willing to do unskilled manual work related to public work at the statutory minimum wage of 120 (US$1.80) per day in 2009 prices. If they fail to do so the government has to pay the salary at their homes. The central government outlay for the scheme was 4000 billion (US$61 billion) in the financial year 2010–11.
This act was introduced with the aim of improving the purchasing power of semi- or un-skilled rural people of India, irrespective of whether or not they fell below the poverty line. Around one-third of the stipulated work force is women. The law was initially called the National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (NREGA) and was renamed with the prefix “Mahatma Gandhi” on 2 October 2009, Gandhi’s birth anniversary.
In the year of 2011, the program was commonly criticized as no more effective than other hardship decrease programs in the country of India. Regardless of its finest objectives, popular MGNREGA is beset with debate about damaged authorities, lack funding as the source of resources, low quality of facilities designed under this program, and random dangerous impact on hardship.
BACKGROUND AND COVERAGE OF MGNREGA
The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) is a flagship Programme of Government of India. The Act was notified initially in 200 most backward districts of the country w.e.f. February 02, 2006 and subsequently extended all over India in two phases:- it was extended to additional 130 districts added in the financial year 2007-2008 (113 districts were notified with effect from April 1st, 2007, and 17 districts in Uttar Pradesh (UP) were notified with effect from May 15th, 2007).
The remaining districts have been notified under MGNREGA with effect from April 1, 2008. Thus, the MGNREGA covers the entire country with the exception of districts that have a hundred percent urban population. The programme aims at enhancing livelihood security of the rural poor by providing at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment in a financial year to every household whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled manual work.
The Act seeks to create durable assets and strengthen the livelihood resource base of the rural poor. The choice of works suggested in the Act address causes of chronic poverty like drought, deforestation, soil erosion so that the process of employment generation is on a sustainable basis.

patterns: goals of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
what is the moto of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
what is the aim of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)
what is the purpose of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)
what is the objective of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)
what is the plan of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)
responses:
Every Act has some goals and aims to be achieved. The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act was also enacted with some aim and goals. These goals are:To provide social protection for the most vulnerable people living in rural India by providing employment opportunities to them.
To provide Livelihood security for the poor through the creation of durable assets, improved water security, soil conservation, and higher land productivity.
To have efficient Drought-proofing and flood management in rural India.
Empowerment of the socially disadvantaged people, especially women, Scheduled Castes (SCs) and     Schedules Tribes (STs), through the processes of rights-based legislation.
Strengthening decentralized, participatory planning through the convergence of various anti-poverty and livelihoods initiatives.
Deepening democracy at the grass-roots by strengthening Panchayati Raj Institutions.
Effecting greater transparency and accountability in governance.
Thus, MGNREGA is a powerful instrument for ensuring inclusive growth in rural India through its impact on social protection, livelihood security, and democratic empowerment.

patterns: what are the salient features of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
what are the features of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
explain the sakient features of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
responses:
The salient features of the Act are as follow:
All adult members of a rural household willing to do unskilled manual work have the right to demand employment 
Such a household will have to apply registration to the Gram Panchayat.
After verification, the Gram Panchayat will issue a Job Card with photograph of all adult members of the household willing to work under the programme. 
The Job Card must remain in the custody of the household.
 Job Cardholder can apply for work to the Gram Panchayat which will issue him/her a dated receipt of the work application.
 Employment will be provided by the Gram Panchayat (local self-governing body) within 15 days of work application, failing which unemployment allowance will be paid.
 Disbursement of wages has to be done weekly basis and not beyond a fortnight. 
 Wages will be paid at the wage rate to the wage earners through their Bank/Post office accounts.
 An annual shelf of works to be prepared in advance for each year.
 A ratio of 60:40 for wage and material costs should be maintained at the GP level. 
 No contractors/and no labor-displacing machinery shall be used in the execution of works.
 Panchayati Raj Institutions will have a principal role in planning, monitoring, and implementation.
 At least one-third of the workers should be women.
Inbuilt incentive-disincentive structure to the State Government for guaranteeing employment.

patterns: what are the challenges of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
responses:
The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) has been a subject of debate since its inception. Some of the challenges faced by MGNREGA are:
 Low wage rates: MGNREGA wage rates are now lower than the matching state/UT minimum wages in 34 of 35 states and union territories1.
Corruption: The scheme witnesses rampant corruption and the bureaucracy overlooks it2. 
Uneven implementation: Data shows that the scheme hasn’t been evenly implemented in terms of the wages given across all the states2.
Slow progress: Since June 2014, the scheme has slowed down progress2.
Lack of interest among workers: The low wage rates have resulted in lack of interest among workers in working for MGNREGA schemes 
I hope this helps!

patterns: what are the benefits of Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
advantages Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act(MGNREGA)?
benefits of MGNREGA act
responses:
The Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA) provides a minimum guarantee of **100 days of work** in a year to rural households whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled standard work¹. The scheme aims to alleviate the problem of unemployment, especially in the rural sector, by providing people with a minimum income by providing their services².  
In addition, one-third of the recommended jobs will be maintained for women¹. If the candidate is not engaged within 15 days, then he or she will be allowed a regular unemployment allowance¹. The scheme has noticeably reduced poverty levels in India by a huge amount and has helped many women in rural areas³.
